Take action to urge Milwaukee County to withdraw its application to the 287(g) program.
  

Stop Trump's Mass Deportation Agenda

Urge Milwaukee County to withdraw its application to the 287(g) program.
TAKE ACTION
   Share this:                  

If you forward, the links will open to a page with your personal information.

Dear ##first_name[Supporter]##,

Acting Sheriff Richard Schmidt wants the Trump administration to turn his deputies into federal immigration agents – and we're running out of time to stop him.

Call Sheriff Schmidt and Milwaukee County leaders TODAY and tell them to withdraw their 287(g) application.

Sheriff Schmidt has applied to be part of a program called 287(g), which allows local police to enforce federal immigration law. This would allow local sheriff's deputies to work with ICE to raid people's homes, tear families apart, and round up members of our community for deportation.

Tell Sheriff Schmidt that he took an oath to protect and serve, not detain and deport.

The 287(g) program is known to destroy police-community trust, waste taxpayer dollars and make our communities less safe. We only have until Monday, November 13 to convince Milwaukee County to withdraw its application to become part of President Trump's mass deportation force.

Take action before it's too late.

Sincerely,

Chris Ott
Executive Director
ACLU of Wisconsin
